TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/ExplorerBar/HeaderBackground extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a for the background of the Explorer Bar. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ExplorerBar.HeaderBackground.Normal%2A> property of the VisualStyleElement.ExplorerBar.HeaderBackground class gets a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> that represents the background of the Explorer Bar.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ExplorerBar.HeaderBackground.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementExplorerBarHeaderBackground1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#137](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/9aed05bd-723c-4c75-8c7b-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#137](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/9aed05bd-723c-4c75-8c7b-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the background of the Explorer Bar.
Docs.value: A that represents the background of the Explorer Bar.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementExplorerBarHeaderBackground1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#137](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/a12cb5a5-e1e6-4c87-976d-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#137](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/a12cb5a5-e1e6-4c87-976d-_1.vb)]
